intro: Lepidium violiforme, commonly known as the violet mustard, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has small, violet-colored flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lepidium violiforme is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
